intro: Barjonia laxa, commonly known as the slender barjonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, oblong fruits. Barjonia laxa is adapted to arid environments and has a low, spreading growth habit.
